Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Bernabeu”
Reviews.Author: stupidscreennamebox
Reviews.Content: I use this hotel when visiting Madrid on business. It is a little way out of town, but perfect for Bernabeu. Rooms are good size, breakfast has a great choice and reception staff are always friendly and efficient. Normally I only do one night in hotel so have never used leisure facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Big spacious room, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: 4animal
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and spacious with a great view! We stayed with 3 in one room in the 14th floor. Breakfast buffet was amazing. So many different things to eat and drink (healthy and continental), even for people who can't drink milk or are on a special diet. Nice gym, and easy to get the 150bus just outside the hotel to the city centre for 1.5€ Everything you expect from a hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stand”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night, thus the title. I thought it was excellent and the staff are very helpful and professional. The location is perfect and there are great bars and restaurants nearby. The room was lovely and clean I must highlight the fantastic pillows. A hotel with good pillows normally has high standards.

Reviews.Title: “Good for large hotel in major city”
Reviews.Author: tesoroSpain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it was close to the Santiago Bernabeu stadium where Bruce Springsteen was performing. Nice spacious room. Large bathroom. Clean and quiet which was appreciated. We did not have any meals here as the breakfast buffet seemed too expensive. Breakfasted at a Starbucks up the street. Parking in the same building was pricey but convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again, NH in Spain”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Internet Charge is 20 euro per day, SPA for guests is special offer 15€ per day, BUT you have to buy a cap Before you are allowed in the small pool for 6€. My Plege: Never again we will go to any Hotel that charges over 100€ for a room with no free internet. BTW I payed over 110€. I have no words for such a strategy to scare me away. It seems that all NH Hotels are so stupid, so beware of booking there. Breakfast was ok if you are spanish, if not you will miss real

Reviews.Title: “Sneaky and outrageous charges”
Reviews.Author: Ranger1976
Reviews.Content: Place is OK, location quite far from downtown. Rooms large but a bit out of date, dirty walls and ceilings. Food is OK to poor. Breakfast below average for this type of hotel.Limited choice and kep running out of things. What however makes me mad are the hotel extra charges. - There are no irons available in the hotel - to iron a shirt is €15 - outrageous. - The economy internet in the room seems OK at €10, until you realise how slow it is and need the upgraded one for €17. - The gym is extra €10, every other hotel I go to has a free gym,and to use the pool.. €21! The staff are also none too friendly - very much of the "computer says no..." attitude, not at all helpful and approaching rude. There are so many better choices in Madrid, and the rip-off services along with the unfriendly staff make this a poor choice.

Reviews.Title: “Almost pretty good”
Reviews.Author: AssimilatedCajun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Eurobuilding because it was our conference hotel, which appears to be how they get a lot of their business. There are many things about the hotel that would be quite attractive if they were not tarnished by closely related flaws: -- The rooms and bathrooms are fairly large. Our room even had a little corridor or anteroom that was a useful buffer against noise in the hallway. And our double room was big enough for a king-size bed with room to spare. In fact, however, the bed consisted of twin beds pushed together. The headboard was king- or maybe queen-size, but each of the twin matresses had its own set of twin-size sheets, so my wife and I were really sleeping in separate beds. --The breakfast was diverse and tasty. But on the first morning, when I tried to make cappuccino on the self-service espresso/cappucino machine, the forced air did not produce any foam but instead sprayed coffee all over everything. Apparently the cappuccino part of the machine had not worked for a long time. Instead of apologizing, one of the waiters chastised me for trying to make cappuccino. He then said that if we wanted cappuccino we should have asked for it -- an option that had not been offered until that very moment -- and in a few minutes he did produce a couple of cups of good cappuccino, although he could not resist scolding us again. On subsequent mornings, several of the more senior waiters were hovering over us with impatient expressions in the apparent hope that this would make us leave the breakfast room soon. -- No facilities for making coffee or tea in the room. No iron or ironing board. Tiny and barely usable bathroom amenities including tangerine-flavored shampoo and kiwi-flavored body wash. -- The spa looks very nice from the outside. But it costs 10 Euros extra per day to use the exercise room, 20 Euros if you would also like to use the steam, sauna, and/or lap pool, so we did not find out what it looked like on the inside. -- Internet in the room is another 10+ Euros per day for the "economy" plan, 20+ Euros for the more useful "business" plan. But there's free wireless in the lobby, in 30-minute increments with coupons obtained from the front desk. -- Many of the hotel employees are just wonderful. The maids/housekeepers were awfully nice to us, as were the receptionists (but not most of the waiters) in the breakfast room and some of the younger front desk staff. But too many of their senior colleagues, like some of the senior waiters, seemed to consider themselves executive material and often behaved as if they would really prefer not to deal with customers. -- Like most everything else about the hotel, the location is OK but not great. It's several kilometers north of the city center, about a five-minute walk from the Cuzco subway stop, which is on line 10. Once you're on the subway it's about a twenty-minute ride to the Plaza Del Sol (including a change at Tribunal station that includes a long and labyrinthine walk). There are some pleasant restaurants in the neighborhood, including four that are right across the street from the hotel. But the neighborhood does not have the charm or the convenience of neighborhoods closer to the heart of Madrid. . --

Reviews.Title: “need transparency in charges”
Reviews.Author: MexKaz
Reviews.Content: The place is very nice, although some parts of the facility look old and some equipment in the rooms. Location is good, close metro and Santiago bernabeu. Breakfast is great, probably the best think in the hotel. Internet is free in public areas but is anoying that you have to put another password every 30 mins and that you have limitations in information transfeer. My biggest problem with this hotel is that you pay a rate and then everything else comes with secrets like: It has a fitness center, but is not included, rates are not in the website, and when you arrive you notice is 20Euros pero day, then you go there and you realize you need a cap for the SPA that is 6 Euros. The gym and SPA are aswesome, but why not being clear and inform? the same with many other things. HAving things charged separately is good because then you can build your own trip depending on your budget. Bad thing, there is no transparency and what is included and what is not and by how much.

Reviews.Title: “Clean nothing extra hotel in Madrid business area”
Reviews.Author: Dalaroe
Reviews.Content: A hotel with quite large rooms that seems to be a little outdated but adequate. Beds are also ok but the air condition is not working in April and just trying the fan is noisy but the temperature sunk somewhat. The rooms are clean, bathrooms are ok -- personally I prefer a shower instead of a bathtub. As other viewers has said everything is extra -- irritating is that even a slow wi-fi costs extra between 10-20 € a day. The breakfast buffet is good but I have eaten better elsewhere and you always have to wait for an omelette even if there is just a few guests. But when I have some business in the area it is quite convenient to stay there anyhow.

Reviews.Title: “No air condition in march & April- rooms extremely hot!”
Reviews.Author: Ok135
Reviews.Content: 1. The rooms are extremely hot, and it's hard to sleep and to work in the room because it's too hot! When I asked what happend to the air condition, the hotel staff said that they dont operate it in "winter" times, and I can open the window to get air from outside... I opened the window, the outside air is hardly getting into the 2 inches the window opened, and the room is not cooling down. Besides, there is a horrible noise from the street and cars when the window is open!!! 2. Only 2 power outlets in the room (another one in the toilet) 3.No iron the room. 4. Wi fi is expansive. 5. When leaving the room- no electricity so its impossible to charge laptop/ iPad while leaving the room. Positive points: The spa & gym are great, huge rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Everything costs money!”
Reviews.Author: Eleni_gak
Reviews.Content: I visit this hotel quite often over the last couple of years, for both business and pleasure, and mainly because I find its location quite convenient for my works (very close to the Metro stop of Cuzco). The hotel's staff is always a challenge to communicate with, perhaps in view of their lack of English. Furthermore, the rooms, although spacious and clean, they are not very modern. The hotel's biggest disadvantage is that everything is excluded from the price of the room: the Wi-Fi costs around 20Euros / day, the fitness room costs another 20 Euros no matter how long you need to use it for. The breakfast, although one of the best I have tried around (with many options to choose from and a never-ending refill of the buffet) is very expensive (approx 20 Euros). Room service and mini-bar are quite expensive as well. In general, the hotel's policy is to over-charge the client as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the NH Eurobuildings Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: In short the Hotel offers a consistent no frills service that is adequate for business guests. The positives are the large well laid out rooms, clean feel, good location for those with meetings to the north of the City and a Breakfast banquet to kick start any day. The negatives are the friendliness of the Reception Staff (they are not unfriendly but they will not go out of their way to make you welcome), basic facilities like in room internet and basic gym access are charged at a high premium and the room service menu is both strange and restrictive in its options. In summary you will not be unhappy with your stay but equally you will not be sad to leave. With more time you may well find better options but be careful because you could also find worse.

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick B
Reviews.Content: The hotel clearly targets business travelers and conference organizers. The rooms are very spacious, large and comfortable bed and bath room and adequate meeting facility. It is not a new hotel, signs of wear and tear. Breakfast really was a treath, abundance of choice and very good coffee. Wifi is not free in the rooms, in the lobby you can get half an hour free with a voucher. I really don't think this is still acceptable these days, many hotels offer decent wifi as part of their standard offering.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and spacious”
Reviews.Author: dekockn
Reviews.Content: I staid here for 2 nights and was generally pleased with the hotel. My room was spacious although a little "tired" in places. I staid on the 6th floor and didn't have a nice view, overlooking another grey building across the street. The conference facilities were good. There was no free Wi-fi available, but the reception did provide a courtesy voucher to use the internet. The front-office staff were efficient, even though not very friendly. My only real gripe is that there are no facilities to make coffee in the room. I might stay here again for business, but not for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Not Clean - Visible Wear and Tear”
Reviews.Author: BruderLustig
Reviews.Content: the first thing that greeted me when I stepped out of the taxi was a filthy worn out outdoor carpet and a threatening security guard - Oh oh - where am I here ? check in was quick and not too welcoming; first impressions of the room was : a lot of suspicious stains in the bed room and the bath room. Oh well it's just for one night - I will survive. went to diner in an Italian restaurant across the street: unfriendly waitress and lousy food. Not good. Surprise on the next morning: the breakfast buffet in this NH hotel is fantastic ! excellent selection of Spanish cold cuts and other stuff; full service station for getting your eggs prepared any style. but that's about it; glad I was out of there. Good thing the metro station is about 5 min away by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Not accommodating and frankly not friendly”
Reviews.Author: Souris52
Reviews.Content: Hotel room is ok, room size good. TV options are awful unless you are bilingual. You have to pay for Internet access. Staff is not friendly at all. For the first time that I have stayed at any hotel and checked in early AND THE ROOM WAS ALREADY AVAILABLE, I was charged $30 Euros to check in early. For foreign travelers whose flights frequently arrive early, and may want to clean up before heading out to a meeting or even sightseeing, FORGET THIS PLACE. Believe me they won't budge and they aren't nice about it. They just talk down to you as if you are an idiot. I have traveled over 150,000 miles this year alone and stayed at many hotels where I checked in before official check in. Never once was I charged. FYI, don't get room service, food is not worth the price.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Prague, Hlavni Mesto Praha, Czech Republic
Reviews.Title: “No way should this be a 4* hotel - amenities awful”
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: I am currently sat in my room at the NH eurobuilding writing this review. The room itself is excellent, a good size and the bathroom is good. Unfortunatly that is all I have to say for it in a positive light. I have stayed in many Hotels around europe and this is far the worst for amenities (and in no way better for room or location). There is no coffe/tea facilities in the room, the gym and spa are not included in the price and the one that really annoys me is that there is no Iron/Trouser press. Fair enough I thought sometimes you have to ask for them, so I asked reception and they told me they do not have them 'Because they are too frivilous and took too much time' and I should use their cleaning/ironing service instead. Which only picks up in the morning and drops off the day after. And having checked the prices (10Euros a shirt, 9Euros for trousers) I will not consider that not to mention that I checked in mid afternoon - it will be cheaper to buy an iron and leave it here. I am hence left with two days of meetings and creased shirts - I am now dreading to see what the breakfast will be like in the morning. The reception also had to be pressed into admitting that the corporate deal we had included internet and to get the tokens from them. From my calculation whatever price you manage to get the hotel for you need to add: 10Euros/Day for Coffee 20Euros/Day for Ironing 10Euros/Day for Gym 20Euros/Day to use Sauna after Gym Very soon that 25 Euros you saved on the other hotel does not look so good

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, noisy location”
Reviews.Author: MainzSleeper
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the subway station with downtown only a 15 minute train ride away. Unfortunately, the people at the reception are unable to tell you that. That was one of our worst experiences service wise. Service was terrible in all aspects. Breakfast was good, somewhat above average for a 4 star hotel. Unfortunately, dinner was terrible and the waiters rude. The hotel is close to one of the major highways of Madrid, so try to avoid those rooms close to it.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old Dame with lovely big room and views.”
Reviews.Author: BelindaBenoni
Reviews.Content: Visited for a business conference with >200 delegates. Awesome food for selection and taste - we ate dinners, lunches and breakfasts here. This is an old building with large bedrooms, large bathrooms with bath that you can lie in (divine) and a shower (into bath). Bathroom in need of new tiles decor - clean but outdated. Lovely view of city from your window. 3min walk to Bernabeau stadium. Biggest drawback was the 3 lifts which service 15 floors. Not uncommon to wait 10 min for a lift. Also restrooms for conference were few and far between. The conference rooms could use some updating as they have a distinct 70s feel to them still! Metro station -Cuzco- 4min walk away on Blue line 10 gives you great access to all the city musts.Buy a metro day pass for EUR6 and ride all day everywhere. Numerous restaurants and bars within 1min walk. Free wireless internet in lobby (30min) was perfect for me as I only needed to gain a quick access to emails once a day. Full internet is expensive all over Europe, here it costs depending on whether you have a mobile device (EUR9) or a laptop (EUR17) per 24h.

Reviews.Title: “Next to Santiago Bernabeau, close to small shops, restaurants and more”
Reviews.Author: marita13
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel to stay at, not centrally located but if you take the bus or metro you will get there in minutes. It is only a few minutes away from Puerta del Sol and Plaza Mayor. Santiago Bernabeau is at walking distance if you're a soccer fan, close to the bus stops, shops, restaurants and metro close by. I believe the breakfast was extra it was not included in our rate. The hotel overall was nice and away from all the "noise"

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!!”
Reviews.Author: PLH00
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip and stayed in this hotel. I had a basic room on level 13 and was very impressed by the size. The bathroom was big with a wardrobe fitted in. It was perfect as the steam got rid of the creases of the hanged clothes ;) The breakfast had a variety of options to choose from. It was amazing to see how much variety they had. The staff were pleasant n warm. It has two bars n they serve nibbles FOC ;) The metro station was walking distance. Although not very centrally located but the tube ride is fairly smooth in Madrid and cheap too!! Would definitely use it again when I go back to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, not fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: tourist1989_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, staff were lovely and the rooms were nice and clean. Restaurant was nice, lobby beautiful. Unfortunate about the location but right next to a metro only a few stops away from centre and right next to the Real Madrid Stadium for any football fans!

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vonneytraveldotcom
Reviews.Content: Great conference hotel - not too far from Madrid centre. Fantastic breakfasts and good catering for the entire conference. Rooms are good, I paid a smaill upgrade for a corner room with balcony - not that I had time to use it! Therefore, not sure that the upgrade was worthwhile. But the rooms genrally are a very good size, with all the modern facilities one would expect. Nothing to grumble about at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: rhoughta
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 10 nights while my wife was on business. Located near the stadium, the neighborhood has many surprises. The are good places to eat on every corner and nightlife that goes on until dawn. Take a cab out front and head out to anywhere in Madrid. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for Asians”
Reviews.Author: dankoh77
Reviews.Content: Recently I've stayed at this hotel on 2 occasions during an insight vacation. I had the worst treatment by the hotel service staff after being on many overseas business trips. On the first day of stay, as the hotel is not located in the central area of Madrid, I was meet with sarcastic remarks when i asked for any recommended restaurants/cafes around the hotel area ( I was told off by the counter staff that they do not know what to recommend to asian.) When I asked politely to get a city map, I was told to get it from my tour leader but the next second another nationality tour member (behind me) asked and got it with the staff pointing out the place of interests in Madrid. Seeing that I asked for the map again and got the same answer before. I need to insist that I get a map before the counter staff relentently pass it to me. Got the same kind of treatment during the breakfast at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Spa”
Reviews.Author: BepeAustralia
Reviews.Content: We relaxed and enjoyed the pool area on the roof of this hotel. It had whirlpools, jets, lap pool, -- you name it! We upgraded from a standard room so that we could use the pool for free each day. Well worth it! The high speed internet was expensive. Location could have been more central.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid NH”
Reviews.Author: Ramana_CV
Reviews.Content: large clean rooms, heart of city, close to barnebu stadium

Reviews.Title: “Great conference hotel near Estadio Santiago Bernabeu!”
Reviews.Author: cassie26
Reviews.Content: I was here on an IB training course so I think the lunch was part of the course catered by the hotel, but it was fabulous. Breakfast was good, lots of choice but on first morning with 150 other IB people they didn't cope too well with the volume of people, coffee machine ran out of coffee and waiters just ignored me when I approached them. Next morning was fine. The metro is really close and very cheap, 1Euro a trip, 2 from the airport. Taxis are reasonable and plentiful too, so even though its a bit further out that didnt hinder us. Plus you are very close to the Real Madrid stadium, which during the World Cup was great watching Spain Portugal on big screens outside! Fab atmosphere. Room was massive, all in all very good. Not sure how much it was as a business trip so cannot comment really on value.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great breakfest a bit noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: aaa26
Reviews.Content: Though it is far from historic centre but Cusco metro station is 5 minutes walk only. So all in all you can reach Puerta del Sol in 30 min. The building is not so impressive from outside but the rooms are OK. Beds are very comfortable. I stayed on the 12.th floor though it was still a bit noisy even with closed windows. The breakfast was really great (jambon, chorizo, fruits, sushi etc.) Free WiFi hot spot is available at the reception area only. (you need to ask for an access code from the reception)

Reviews.Title: “Conference Hotel without frills”
Reviews.Author: Xamb
Reviews.Content: The basics are fine: This is a conference facility, in a pleasant but not very interesting part of Madrid. The rooms are large, and the check in and check out are efficient. The breakfast is crowded and a little disorganized, but the variety and quality of food is good. There were a lot of oddities and flaws, however. First, the internet connection was not functioning for the first night and following morning of my stay. A major business/conference hotel like this one needs a backup or on-site technician. Second, the design of the room was unusual. The wardrobe is in the bathroom! There is no coffee maker or clock. The lifts (elevators) are painfully slow, with long waits on upper floors. I am not one who takes much advantage of porters or concierge desks, but the absence of anyone to carry luggage or provide advice and special services is also a gap in a hotel of this kind. The conference room rate at this hotel was reasonable, but expect a no-frills experience at this example of the NH chain.

Reviews.Title: “Ottimo”
Reviews.Author: BeppeGinevra
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days for a congress and i have truly enjoyed my stay. Great breakfast, good food, very clean and comfortable room, excellent conference center. Internet access was not free though :-(

Reviews.Title: “NH Eurobuilding stay for FITUR”
Reviews.Author: Assafbd
Reviews.Content: while going to FITUR for 2009 travel trade show i stayed at NH Eurobuilding for 3 days. Breakfasts were excellent and the room was very comfortable, I took the addition of a very neat Jim every morning what did the difference for me. I made the reservation with lastminutetravel.com - what was extremely good price.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: zannnie
Reviews.Content: Like the variety of the breakfast. we had four breakfasts in a row and it was quite pleasant to be not bored with the types of different selection/combination for the breakfast every morning. The only setback is it is relatively far from the downtown being a business hotel. The Real Madrid (Santiago Bernabeu) stadium is in walking proximity though :)

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel with mediocre service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: sjp3003
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to attend a conference held there. The hotel is dated, has mediocre service and rooms are out of date as well. Bathrooms are fair at best and soap rations are meager. The breakfast buffet, however, is very good. The busiess center is nothing more than two PC's in the lobby and a printer!

Reviews.Title: “Too Far from Central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SoFLTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located fairly far from the tourist area of Madrid. The Cuzco stop on the Metro is a five minute walk from the hotel. There are a few restaurants across from the hotel and an upscale convenience store two short blocks to the right as you exit the Lobby. The room was clean but forgettable. There were only two English channels on the TV. The breakfast was uninspired. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice if they turned the air conditioning on!”
Reviews.Author: bezzaact
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, as others have said it is a bit out of town but some nice restaurants in the neighbourhood. My main problem with the hotel is that it was HOT and they refused to turn on the air conditioning in the rooms until our third night there. Spent a very uncomfortable night. Staff also unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff. Good gym.”
Reviews.Author: Annibee
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and caring staff - the restaurant waiters were attentive and the desk staff very responsive to requests, and this made a pleasant change to some hotels. The breakfasts were good although I would take my own tea bags next time as I like stronger tea. I can not recommend lunch or dinner there as it was highly repetitive and not so tasty. The room was stylish and pleasant with a nice dressing area and all the facilities e.g. free safe. Bed was firm and comfortable. A little traffic noise. Be careful not to take a bottle out of the minibar as it is pressure sensitive and will autocharge your room although I can't imagine the hotel would actually bill you for something you didn't use. Decent hairdrier and complimentary extras e.g. a hairbrush, shaving kits. Although you have to pay extra to use, there were very good gym facilities and the spa was nice but a very small pool to actually swim in. They gave complimentary flipflops and swim caps along with a good range of toiletries on the ladies side - staff look after you. The Metro is 5 mins walk away and at 1 euro a trip in to centre made good, clean mode of travel. Very easy to get to Airport by Metro for 3 euro - don't waste around 30 euro on a taxi, spend it on Tapas in the centre and have great fun in this lovely city!

Reviews.Title: “Totally fine hotel with good gym - about 12 euro taxi into town”
Reviews.Author: Hoboken Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and it really was a fine hotel. The check in and service was very friendly and attentive. The beds were fine, the rooms large and the bathroom had everything you need. It is a little out of town so it is about 12 euros into town which could be annoying if you were staying here as a tourist. Internet charged 22 euros a day I didn't have breakfast but the rest of my party who did said it was very good. I used the gym and have to say it is one of the better hiotel gyms I have ever used - everything you need and multiple cardio machines - all new.

Reviews.Title: “Only because it was business”
Reviews.Author: hello777
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the NH Eurobuilding during a conference my husband was attending. Pros: Very clean, 5 minute walk to Metro, small shopping mall and stores, restaurants (even a Starbucks if you can't live without!). Neighbourhood was more interesting than I expected for a business oriented area. Cons: Everything was extra. Breakfast buffet was great, but who can eat $30 worth of food for breakfast? WiFi service was unreliable (we ended up getting refunded) and over $20/day. Even from the 11th floor, street noise was an issue so had to keep windows closed all the time. Rooms were nice, but nothing special for a hotel so expensive, especially in a city with so many other options.

Reviews.Title: “Business Hotel not for tourist”
Reviews.Author: Hi888US
Reviews.Content: This is a business hotel, it's too far away from where the action is. In short its not for tourist its for business.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalore
Reviews.Content: The Hotel room we got was superb because we paid extra. At the front desk you quickly get the impression that you must pay more to be happy: they have two large signs that for 40 Euros more you get an upgrade, and for 75 Euros more, a mini-suite. We took the 40 Euros upgrade and we appreciated our one night stay (our agent had said it was close to the airport and they had a shuttle: neither was true! but that is our agent!), the room was very nice and we had access to the Spa which is superb: a lap-pool, a jacuzzi, a sauna, etc. very nice. Someone else here was saying that breakfast was superb: it is, but it also is 20 Euros, that is 30$. let me tell you that it adds up fast. All NH Hotels charge 17 Euros for wi-fi, per laptop!!! This is preposterous and I hope they will eventually change this when they receive too many complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice communal areas - shame about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dave Clarke
Reviews.Content: Nice communal areas that are clean, modern and welcoming but a shame that the rooms don't match up. This hotel has great public areas but the rooms need to be refurbished - nothing you can put you finger on and they are clean but they need some money spending on them. I was here for three nights in Sept '07 with a booking made by my company and they put me on the 16th floor. What can I say the lift only goes to the 15th I think that I was in a loft addition!! They did supply a porter for luggage though. Food in the restaurant is great (buffet lunch was the largest I had seen and all good quality). Although from picture the Spa looks fantastic but I always resent paying for a leisure facility when I am a guest in the hotel. I guess they are trying to recover the cost of refitting it?

Reviews.Title: “OK for business”
Reviews.Author: London Frequent Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business (booked by the organizers of a convention) in March 2007. It is a very standard business hotel in central Madrid, two blocks east of the Castellana. The reception area is unimpresive and appears understaffed quite a lot of the time, but the public area behind it is generous and a good place for meeting. The rooms are reasonably sized and well laid out, especially the bathroom/dressing area (a feature I have noticed elsewhere with this chain); external noise, at least from the 10th floor, was no worse than usual for central Madrid. The buffet breakfast was outstanding once you could find your way around (with juice glasses concealed under the juices themselves!) The business centre offered 15-minute free internet access which was useful, though attempts to extend this with a credit card resulted in a crash. One problem seemed to be under-provision of elevators, with long waits at peak periods when everyone is in a hurry. Overall: very average.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Fe3O4
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at this hotel from Monday Oct. 2 thru Friday Oct. 6, 2006. Primary purpose of trip was a business meeting that took place in this hotel. We arrived the evening of Oct 2nd about 11:00PM. The front desk was not friendly at all. We received no information about the hotel or hotel services from the front desk. We had requested a king bed and when we arrived at the room it was 2 twins. After a call to the front desk we were told we could change the next day. The hotel furnishings look to be late 70's, early 80's contemporary. Rooms are somewhat dated and in need of upgrading. This hotel is for business travelers and business meetings. The hotel is located on the northside of Madrid. It is 3-4 blocks north of the Real Madrid Futbol Stadium. This area is a typical modern city area and seems to be safe. My wife & I walked to and from the Metro on several occasions late in the evenings and didn't have any uncomfortable moments. The hotel is 2-3 blocks from a Metro station. We traveled the Metro on several occasions without any issues at all. A 10-pass ticket is available for about 7 Euros. This is the most economical & easy way to get around Madrid. The Hop-On Hop-Off tourist bus makes a stop at the Real Madrid Stadium. 2-day pass is about 20 Euros. You can buy passes at virtually any newspaper stand and probably at your hotel. There is two routes, Historic Madrid and Modern Madrid. The best thing about this hotel for us was the breakfast buffet. It was very plentiful and good. An omelet chef was on duty and great selection of breads, fruit and meats. Self-serve espresso/cappucinno machine and great fruit juices available. They even had sushi for breakfast. Bottom line - Would we stay at this hotel again? Not if it was my choice. If this stay was strictly for business I would not mind staying. Certainly not for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “OK, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Madrid in a business trip and stayed 3 nights in Eurobuilding. Quite nice hotel with a bit luxurious entrance. What was a bit confusing was that all the time the guards were standing in a lobby equipped with their sidearms. It was something that I'm not used to. Quite expensive too, 169 €/night at that time.
